result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine Carol Karlstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christine Carol Karlstad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christine Carol Karlstad was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.
  • Christine Carol Karlstad was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
Not enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Submit DNA sample.
Comply with any correctional programming deemed necessary by the Department of Corrections.
Pay court obligations.
Pay supervision fees determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Partial. Sentencing Hearing held on April 27, 2016 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed CR J Krueger

3:30 Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Froelich gives recommendation of 3 years conf & 3 years ext supervision. Atty Newmark gives recommendation S/W Probation. Defendant addresses the Court. Court orders on Count 1 - 2.5 years confinement, 2.5 years extended supervision. Conditions of ES  No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. No entry into bar taverns or liquor stores. No contact with any known drug dealer or user. DNA sample and surcharge. Comply with any programs deemed necessary by DOC.  Pay court costs, fines & restitution as determined by the court. Pay supervision fees of DOC. 
Count 3 court orders 30 days in the PCJ concurrent to prison sentence in Count 1. Appeal rights given to def. 4:10
from Atty Newmark re: two letters from Pierce County Department of Human Services
Sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
to reschedule sentencing hearing based on a conflict filed by Atty Newmark. (DA Froelich does not object)

#1 Not Used.
#2 Guilty of Delivery of Methamphetamine as charged in the information.
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 02:00 pm.

9:14 Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 23 jurors seated in the jury box. Judge calls the case. Judge does general voir dire. Atty Froelich does general voir dire. Atty Newmark does general voir dire. 12 jurors plus an alternate are swn. 10:07 Court recesses. 10:38 Court resumes with counsel, Defendant and jury present. Court gives preliminary jury instructions. 10:48 Atty Froelich gives opening statement. 10:56 Atty Newmark gives opening statement. 10:58 Investigator Sheplar swn, ex by Froelich. 11:10 Atty Newmark x ex. Froelich redirect. 11:22 Investigator Doug Ducklow swn, ex by Atty Froelich. Court: all exhibits will be offered and rec'd per stipulations. Exh#1- photo of bag of meth; off/rec. Exh#2-photo of bag with meth; off/rec. Exh#3-picture of the name The Karlstad's; off/rec. Inv. Ducklow ID's Def. Court:  Court: witness has identified the defendant. Atty Newmark x ex. 11:43 Court recesses.  Court resumes at 12:49 p.m.  with counsel, Defendant and jury present.  Froelich calls Joseph Wermeling to testify via phone.  Wermeling is sworn.  Froelich examines Wermeling.  No cross by Newmark.  Froelich calls Michael Krieg.  Krieg is sworn and takes the witness stand.   Froelich examines Krieg.  Ex. 4 - photo of front side of Christine's house.  Off/rec.  Ex 5 - photo, Ex. 6 - photo of kitchen, Ex. 7 - photo of buy area.  Krieg identifies defendant.  Identification stipulated to by Newmark.  Ex. 8 - audio recording of buy, off/rec. Parties stipulate to cleaning up recording later.  Audio recording is played.  Krieg identifies parties in recording as himself and Christine Karlstad.  Newmark cross-examines Michael Krieg.  State rests.  Jury excused at 2:25 p.m.  Court reviews rights with defendant as to her right to testify or remain silent.  Defendant exercises her right to remain silent.  Defendant understands her rights, Newmark agrees.  Court breaks at 2:29 p.m.  Conference on jury instructions at 2:39 p.m.  1620, 6001, 140, 145, 103, 157, 155, 148, 190, 195, 300, 315, 160, 465, 484.  Court resumes at 2:44 p.m.  Counsel and defendant present.  Froelich - started recording omitting first 5 minutes and will get exact time that recording stopped.  Court reviews jury instructions 100, 115, 6020, 6001, 140, 145, 103, 157, 155, 148, 190, 195, 300, 315, 160, 465, verdict 484.  No objections from either counsel.  Court breaks at 2:48 for 15 minutes. 3:08 Court resumes with counsel, defendant and jury present. Court reads jury instructions to the jury. 3:19 Atty Froelich gives closing argument. 3:28 Atty Newmark gives closing argument. 3:36 Atty Froelich gives rebuttal. 3:38 Court reads final jury instructions to the jury. Clerk draws the name of the alternate. 3:42 Jury is excused. 4:12 Court resumes with counsel, defendant and jury present. Jury finds the defendant guilty of the charge contained in the information. Madam foreperson agrees this is the verdict. The Court polls the jury. Each juror answered yes to guilty being the verdict. 4:16 Jury is excused. Court finds the Def guilty of Ct#1 pursuant to the jury verdict. Froelich requests a PSI and for bond to continue and Newmark agrees. Get a sentencing date. Def to remain until she is handed a notice of hearing.

8:35 In the Eastcourtroom. Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial issues are being heard at this time. Court has given counsel proposed jury instructions. Froelich: agreement except for the delivery charge. Dismiss Ct#2, #4. Guilty to Ct#3 with probation recommended, if Def is not convicted to Ct#1 no jail time and if convicted the sentences would be concurrent. Newmark: agreement to limit to testimony of search to the money and pictures.  Froelich agrees. Court: witnesses will be sequestered. Court goes over trial and voir dire procedures with counsel. Court goes over witness list. Will seat 23 jurors and have 1 alternate. Each counsel gets 5 strikes.  Court goes over the Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form with the defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant . Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#3; Newmark stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to ct#3. Dismisses Ct#2 and Ct#4. Defense might ask for a lesser offense at the time of the jury.  Court gives Defendant her constitutional rights to testify or not testify in her own defense. Newmark has no objection to the exhibits be offered by the state. No objection to Atty Newmark's paralegal sitting at counsel table. And no objection to Investigator Sheplar being Atty Froelich's court officer.

3:07 Includes 14CV277 Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark. Atty Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Froelich addresses the Court. Atty Newmark addresses the court, there is no resolution at this time. Jury trial is set for 1/20 & 21, 2016 at 8:30. 3:14

2:41 p.m.  Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also includes 14CV227.  Froelich - not resolved based on new information.  Schedule for 2 day jury trial and final pre-trial 3 weeks ahead of that.  Newmark addresses the court regarding new motion prior to trial. 4:10  Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - defendant is requesting addional time. Judge wants this to be set out in 2 weeks for a plea.

Information is filed with the court.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.. Def pleas not guilty to all counts. Court receives not guilty pleas. Bond to continue.
Pre-trial conference at 06-30-2015 04:00 pm.

3:25 p.m.  Also tracking 14CV227.  Defendant Christine Carol Karlstad in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 05-27-2015 03:15 pm
